text: Drops are a traditional small, round confectionery made from a mixture of boiled sugar and flavourings. They are "dropped" onto a pan or baking sheet to set.Davidson, Alan. The Oxford Companion to Food (Oxford, OUP, 2006), p. 257. In the 1840s, drop roller machines came on the market.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FAyp7KBh8CY These machines took the hot, 120 °C, cooked sugar, and molded it into shapes between two hand cranked brass rollers.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sd90XCvpO1k&list;=PLOpMP4pnVlmBfpAyd9SSSBwMOVq6qecmb&index;=2 == See also == * Acid drop * Chocolate drop * Comfit * Cough drop * Fruit drop * Gumdrop * Kisses (confectionery) * Lemon drop * London drops * Pear drop * Sponge drop == References == Category:British confectionery
